\chapter{HowTos}
\label{\detokenize{source/howtos:howtos}}\label{\detokenize{source/howtos::doc}}

\section{Install the BeagleSystems Software on a drone}
\label{\detokenize{source/howtos/install:install-the-beaglesystems-software-on-a-drone}}\label{\detokenize{source/howtos/install::doc}}
To gain access to the repository, we first have to do some setup:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYGZdl{} git config \PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}global http.postBuffer \PYG{l+m}{524288000}
\PYGZdl{} ssh\PYGZhy{}keygen \PYGZhy{}t rsa \PYGZhy{}b \PYG{l+m}{4096} \PYGZhy{}C \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}your\PYGZus{}email@beaglesystems.com\PYGZdq{}}
\PYGZdl{} cat \PYGZti{}/.ssh/id\PYGZus{}rsa.pub
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

Upload the public key to your github settings to be able to download the repository.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYGZdl{} mkdir Development
\PYGZdl{} \PYG{n+nb}{cd} Development
\PYGZdl{} git clone git@github.com:BeagleSystems/BeagleComrade \PYGZhy{}b develop
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

Create the file \textasciitilde{}/.beaglerc with the following content.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{c+ch}{\PYGZsh{}!/bin/bash}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} !!! Double check that these paths are correctly set !!!}
\PYG{n+nb}{source} /opt/ros/noetic/setup.bash
\PYG{n+nb}{source} /home/david/Development/beaglesystems/BeagleComrade/devel/setup.bash
\PYG{n+nb}{export} \PYG{n+nv}{ROS\PYGZus{}PACKAGE\PYGZus{}PATH}\PYG{o}{=}/home/david/Development/beaglesystems/PX4\PYGZhy{}Autopilot:/home/david/Development/beaglesystems/PX4\PYGZhy{}Autopilot/Tools/sitl\PYGZus{}gazebo:\PYG{n+nv}{\PYGZdl{}ROS\PYGZus{}PACKAGE\PYGZus{}PATH}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} These exports are necessary if you try to run ROS debugging tools connected via WiFi to the drone. Use the same exports on your local computer}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}export ROS\PYGZus{}HOSTNAME=192.168.8.100}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}export ROS\PYGZus{}IP=\PYGZdl{}ROS\PYGZus{}HOSTNAME}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}export ROS\PYGZus{}MASTER\PYGZus{}URI=http://\PYGZdl{}ROS\PYGZus{}HOSTNAME:11311}

\PYG{n+nb}{export} \PYG{n+nv}{GST\PYGZus{}PLUGIN\PYGZus{}PATH}\PYG{o}{=}/usr/local/lib/aarch64\PYGZhy{}linux\PYGZhy{}gnu/gstreamer\PYGZhy{}1.0:/usr/lib/aarch64\PYGZhy{}linux\PYGZhy{}gnu/gstreamer\PYGZhy{}1.0
\PYG{n+nb}{export} \PYG{n+nv}{LD\PYGZus{}LIBRARY\PYGZus{}PATH}\PYG{o}{=}/usr/local/lib/aarch64\PYGZhy{}linux\PYGZhy{}gnu:\PYG{n+nv}{\PYGZdl{}LD\PYGZus{}LIBRARY\PYGZus{}PATH}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{Install FT4232H}
\label{\detokenize{source/howtos/install_ftdi4232h:install-ft4232h}}\label{\detokenize{source/howtos/install_ftdi4232h::doc}}
..code\sphinxhyphen{}block:: sh
\begin{quote}

sudo apt\sphinxhyphen{}get install libconfuse\sphinxhyphen{}dev
\end{quote}


\section{Compile the documentation}
\label{\detokenize{source/howtos/compile_documentation:compile-the-documentation}}\label{\detokenize{source/howtos/compile_documentation::doc}}
We adhere to the recommendations described on \sphinxurl{https://www.writethedocs.org/guide/} and \sphinxurl{https://documentation.divio.com/reference/}. Reference guides are kept in a similar style as \sphinxurl{http://mavlink.io/en/services/mission.html}.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
sudo pip3 install sphinxcontrib\PYGZhy{}mermaid
sudo pip3 install sphinx\PYGZhy{}jinja sphinxcontrib\PYGZhy{}napoleon sphinx\PYGZhy{}rtd\PYGZhy{}theme
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

Install sphinx\sphinxhyphen{}bootstrap\sphinxhyphen{}theme:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+nb}{cd} \PYGZti{}/Development/beaglesystems
git clone git@github.com:dayjaby/sphinx\PYGZhy{}bootstrap\PYGZhy{}theme
\PYG{n+nb}{cd} sphinx\PYGZhy{}bootstrap\PYGZhy{}theme
sudo python3 setup.py install
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

Modify the CSS:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+nb}{cd} \PYGZti{}/Development/beaglesystems
git clone git@github.com:dayjaby/bootstrap
\PYG{n+nb}{cd} bootstrap
npm install
npm install grunt
... modify files \PYG{k}{in} ./less/ ...
./node\PYGZus{}modules/.bin/grunt dist
cp \PYGZhy{}r dist/* \PYGZti{}/Development/beaglesystems/sphinx\PYGZhy{}bootstrap\PYGZhy{}theme/bootstrap/static/bootstrap\PYGZhy{}3.4.1/
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

Create the documentation:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
sphinx\PYGZhy{}apidoc \PYGZhy{}f \PYGZhy{}o source/mqtt\PYGZus{}bridge ../BeagleComrade/src/mqtt\PYGZus{}bridge/src/mqtt\PYGZus{}bridge
make clean \PYG{o}{\PYGZam{}\PYGZam{}} make html
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

Instead of ˙make html˙ you can create the documentation via

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
python3 \PYGZhy{}msphinx . \PYGZus{}build
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\subsection{To generate a pdf using latex}
\label{\detokenize{source/howtos/compile_documentation:to-generate-a-pdf-using-latex}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
sudo apt install texlive\PYGZhy{}full
sudo apt install texlive\PYGZhy{}latex\PYGZhy{}extra
make latexpdf
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

The pdf file is located in doc/\_build/latex/


\section{Debug PX4 topics}
\label{\detokenize{source/howtos/debug_px4:debug-px4-topics}}\label{\detokenize{source/howtos/debug_px4::doc}}
NuttX shell, list all available commands and list all uORB topics:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
nsh\PYGZgt{} \PYG{n+nb}{help}
nsh\PYGZgt{} uorb top
q
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

If you have GPS problems, please check:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
nsh\PYGZgt{} listener vehicle\PYGZus{}gps\PYGZus{}position
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

Is jamming indicator below 40? If not, make sure that all USB3.0 cables are far away from the GPS sensor.

In a SITL environment, we can use GDB to analyze. I assume that you run PX4 via a robot\_upstarted launch file. Make sure that the PX4 ros node is commented out. First, we have to compile PX4 in GDB mode:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+nv}{DONT\PYGZus{}RUN}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m}{1} make px4\PYGZus{}sitl\PYGZus{}default gazebo\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}gdb
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

Next, we start the node as root.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYGZdl{} sudo su \PYGZhy{}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} export HOME=/home/beagle}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} source \PYGZdl{}HOME/.beaglerc}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} gdb \PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}args \PYGZdl{}HOME/Development/beaglesystems/PX4\PYGZhy{}Autopilot/build/px4\PYGZus{}sitl\PYGZus{}rtps/bin/px4 /\PYGZdl{}HOME/Development/beaglesystems/PX4\PYGZhy{}Autopilot/ROMFS/px4fmu\PYGZus{}common \PYGZhy{}s etc/init.d\PYGZhy{}posix/rcS \PYGZhy{}t /\PYGZdl{}HOME/Development/beaglesystems/PX4\PYGZhy{}Autopilot/test\PYGZus{}data}
\PYG{o}{(}gdb\PYG{o}{)} handle SIGCONT noprint nostop
\PYG{o}{(}gdb\PYG{o}{)} run
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

One example how to break on certain mavlink messages, e.g. with mavlink message ID 212:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYGZlt{}ctrl\PYGZhy{}c\PYGZgt{} \PYG{k}{if} GDB is running already
\PYG{o}{(}gdb\PYG{o}{)} \PYG{n+nb}{break} MavlinkReceiver::handle\PYGZus{}message
\PYG{o}{(}gdb\PYG{o}{)} \PYG{k}{continue}
Thread \PYG{l+m}{75} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}mavlink\PYGZus{}rcv\PYGZus{}if1\PYGZdq{}} hit Breakpoint \PYG{l+m}{1}, MavlinkReceiver::handle\PYGZus{}message \PYG{o}{(}\PYG{n+nv}{this}\PYG{o}{=}0x7fff8c000b20, \PYG{n+nv}{msg}\PYG{o}{=}0x7fffc6ffad90\PYG{o}{)}
 at ../../src/modules/mavlink/mavlink\PYGZus{}receiver.cpp:132
 \PYG{l+m}{132}     \PYG{o}{\PYGZob{}}
\PYG{o}{(}gdb\PYG{o}{)} x/20i \PYG{n+nv}{\PYGZdl{}pc}
\PYG{o}{=}\PYGZgt{} 0x55555561d420 \PYGZlt{}MavlinkReceiver::handle\PYGZus{}message\PYG{o}{(}\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}mavlink\PYGZus{}message*\PYG{o}{)}\PYGZgt{}:        push   \PYGZpc{}rbp
   0x55555561d421 \PYGZlt{}MavlinkReceiver::handle\PYGZus{}message\PYG{o}{(}\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}mavlink\PYGZus{}message*\PYG{o}{)}+1\PYGZgt{}:      push   \PYGZpc{}rbx
   0x55555561d422 \PYGZlt{}MavlinkReceiver::handle\PYGZus{}message\PYG{o}{(}\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}mavlink\PYGZus{}message*\PYG{o}{)}+2\PYGZgt{}:      mov    \PYGZpc{}rsi,\PYGZpc{}rbx
   0x55555561d425 \PYGZlt{}MavlinkReceiver::handle\PYGZus{}message\PYG{o}{(}\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}mavlink\PYGZus{}message*\PYG{o}{)}+5\PYGZgt{}:      mov    \PYGZpc{}rdi,\PYGZpc{}rbp
   0x55555561d428 \PYGZlt{}MavlinkReceiver::handle\PYGZus{}message\PYG{o}{(}\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}mavlink\PYGZus{}message*\PYG{o}{)}+8\PYGZgt{}:      sub    \PYG{n+nv}{\PYGZdl{}0}x8,\PYGZpc{}rsp
   0x55555561d42c \PYGZlt{}MavlinkReceiver::handle\PYGZus{}message\PYG{o}{(}\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}mavlink\PYGZus{}message*\PYG{o}{)}+12\PYGZgt{}:     movzbl 0xa\PYG{o}{(}\PYGZpc{}rbx\PYG{o}{)},\PYGZpc{}eax
   0x55555561d430 \PYGZlt{}MavlinkReceiver::handle\PYGZus{}message\PYG{o}{(}\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}mavlink\PYGZus{}message*\PYG{o}{)}+16\PYGZgt{}:     movzbl 0x9\PYG{o}{(}\PYGZpc{}rsi\PYG{o}{)},\PYGZpc{}esi
   0x55555561d434 \PYGZlt{}MavlinkReceiver::handle\PYGZus{}message\PYG{o}{(}\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}mavlink\PYGZus{}message*\PYG{o}{)}+20\PYGZgt{}:     movzbl 0xb\PYG{o}{(}\PYGZpc{}rbx\PYG{o}{)},\PYGZpc{}edx
   0x55555561d438 \PYGZlt{}MavlinkReceiver::handle\PYGZus{}message\PYG{o}{(}\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}mavlink\PYGZus{}message*\PYG{o}{)}+24\PYGZgt{}:     shl    \PYG{n+nv}{\PYGZdl{}0}x8,\PYGZpc{}rax
   0x55555561d43c \PYGZlt{}MavlinkReceiver::handle\PYGZus{}message\PYG{o}{(}\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}mavlink\PYGZus{}message*\PYG{o}{)}+28\PYGZgt{}:     or     \PYGZpc{}rsi,\PYGZpc{}rax
   0x55555561d43f \PYGZlt{}MavlinkReceiver::handle\PYGZus{}message\PYG{o}{(}\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}mavlink\PYGZus{}message*\PYG{o}{)}+31\PYGZgt{}:     shl    \PYG{n+nv}{\PYGZdl{}0}x10,\PYGZpc{}rdx
   0x55555561d443 \PYGZlt{}MavlinkReceiver::handle\PYGZus{}message\PYG{o}{(}\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}mavlink\PYGZus{}message*\PYG{o}{)}+35\PYGZgt{}:     or     \PYGZpc{}rdx,\PYGZpc{}rax
   0x55555561d446 \PYGZlt{}MavlinkReceiver::handle\PYGZus{}message\PYG{o}{(}\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}mavlink\PYGZus{}message*\PYG{o}{)}+38\PYGZgt{}:     cmp    \PYG{n+nv}{\PYGZdl{}0}x8a,\PYGZpc{}eax
   0x55555561d44b \PYGZlt{}MavlinkReceiver::handle\PYGZus{}message\PYG{o}{(}\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}mavlink\PYGZus{}message*\PYG{o}{)}+43\PYGZgt{}:     je     0x55555561d8d0 \PYGZlt{}MavlinkReceiver::handle\PYGZus{}message\PYG{o}{(}\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}mavlink\PYGZus{}message*\PYG{o}{)}+1200\PYGZgt{}
\PYG{o}{(}gdb\PYG{o}{)} delete
\PYG{o}{(}gdb\PYG{o}{)} \PYG{n+nb}{break} *0x55555561d446 \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n+nv}{\PYGZdl{}eax} \PYG{o}{=}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m}{212}
\PYG{o}{(}gdb\PYG{o}{)} info registers \PYG{n+nv}{\PYGZdl{}eax}
\PYG{o}{(}gdb\PYG{o}{)} \PYG{k}{continue}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{How to debug USB}
\label{\detokenize{source/howtos/debug_usb:how-to-debug-usb}}\label{\detokenize{source/howtos/debug_usb::doc}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
sudo apt install libboost\PYGZhy{}dev libpcap\PYGZhy{}dev
git clone https://github.com/aguinet/usbtop
\PYG{n+nb}{cd} usbtop
mkdir build \PYG{o}{\PYGZam{}\PYGZam{}} \PYG{n+nb}{cd} build
cmake \PYGZhy{}DCMAKE\PYGZus{}BUILD\PYGZus{}TYPE\PYG{o}{=}Release ..
make
sudo make install
sudo modprobe usbmon
sudo usbtop
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

Compare that with the USB devices found via lsusb.

USB devices can fail if the voltage drops below 5V. To check the voltage on Jetson Nano, run:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{cat} \PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{sys}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{bus}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{i2c}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{drivers}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{ina3221x}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{l+m+mi}{6}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{l+m+mi}{0040}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{iio}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{n}{device0}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{in\PYGZus{}voltage0\PYGZus{}input}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\chapter{Hardware}
\label{\detokenize{source/hardware:hardware}}\label{\detokenize{source/hardware::doc}}

\section{Payloads}
\label{\detokenize{source/hardware/payloads:payloads}}\label{\detokenize{source/hardware/payloads::doc}}

\subsection{EH2000}
\label{\detokenize{source/hardware/payloads/eh2000:eh2000}}\label{\detokenize{source/hardware/payloads/eh2000::doc}}

\subsubsection{Test commands for the NuttX shell}
\label{\detokenize{source/hardware/payloads/eh2000:test-commands-for-the-nuttx-shell}}
Get the device information and reported feedback from the gimbal:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
listener gimbal\PYGZus{}device\PYGZus{}information
listener gimbal\PYGZus{}device\PYGZus{}attitude\PYGZus{}status
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

Do a camera trigger test:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
camera\PYGZus{}trigger \PYG{n+nb}{test}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

Do a continuous camera trigger test until stopped:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
camera\PYGZus{}trigger test\PYGZus{}interval
camera\PYGZus{}trigger test\PYGZus{}interval stop
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

Make the camera look forward and follow yaw:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
eh2000 \PYG{n+nb}{test} follow
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

Make the camera look down and follow yaw:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
eh2000 \PYG{n+nb}{test} lookdown
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

Make the camera look left/right with a pitch of 45 degrees down:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
eh2000 \PYG{n+nb}{test} lookleft
eh2000 \PYG{n+nb}{test} lookright
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

Prepare the camera for precision landing, which includes the following commands:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
zoom out (\sphinxhref{https://mavlink.io/en/messages/common.html\#MAV\_CMD\_SET\_CAMERA\_ZOOM}{MAV\_CMD\_SET\_CAMERA\_ZOOM})

\item {} 
auto focus (\sphinxhref{https://mavlink.io/en/messages/common.html\#MAV\_CMD\_SET\_CAMERA\_FOCUS}{MAV\_CMD\_SET\_CAMERA\_FOCUS})

\item {} 
follow yaw (\sphinxhref{https://mavlink.io/en/messages/common.html\#MAV\_CMD\_DO\_GIMBAL\_MANAGER\_PITCHYAW}{MAV\_CMD\_DO\_GIMBAL\_MANAGER\_PITCHYAW})

\item {} 
lookdown (\sphinxhref{https://mavlink.io/en/messages/common.html\#MAV\_CMD\_DO\_GIMBAL\_MANAGER\_PITCHYAW}{MAV\_CMD\_DO\_GIMBAL\_MANAGER\_PITCHYAW})

\end{itemize}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
eh2000 \PYG{n+nb}{test} precland
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\section{MQTT interface}
\label{\detokenize{source/mqtt_interface:mqtt-interface}}\label{\detokenize{source/mqtt_interface:id1}}\label{\detokenize{source/mqtt_interface::doc}}
Connecting to MQTT

The MQTT broker is hosted on 40.87.148.13:1883.


\begin{savenotes}\sphinxattablestart
\centering

\begin{footnotetext}[1]\sphinxAtStartFootnote
The timestamp is an additional field in a message and is based on \sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/time.html\#time.time}{time.time()} at the time of transmission of the data. Timestamps of the samples themselves are not included if not stated otherwise.
%
\end{footnotetext}\ignorespaces

&

\subsection{MQTT interface configuration}
\label{\detokenize{source/mqtt_interface_yaml:mqtt-interface-configuration}}\label{\detokenize{source/mqtt_interface_yaml:mqtt-interface-conf}}\label{\detokenize{source/mqtt_interface_yaml::doc}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

Bridge from MQTT to ROS topic
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {}

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{topic\_to}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} outgoing ROS topic path

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{msg\_type}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{class}}) \textendash{} subclass of ROS Message

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{frequency}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float|None}}) \textendash{} publish frequency

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{queue\_size}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} ROS publisher’s queue size

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{wildcards}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list\sphinxhyphen{}of\sphinxhyphen{}str|None}}) \textendash{} list of wildcards. If it is not None, replace any + in topic\_from with the values in this list.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{latch}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool|False}}) \textendash{} whether to latch the message

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}
